How to anonymously share information with The Globe's investigative team

Learn More

Situation 'stable' after fighting between India and China troops

India and China said they wanted peace but blamed each other on Wednesday after soldiers of the two sides savagely fought each other with nail-studded clubs and stones on their Himalayan border, killing at least 20 Indian troops.

Play video

COVID-19 cases surging in several U.S. states

New cases of COVID-19 nearly doubled in Alabama and South Carolina in the second week of June compared to the prior seven days, a Reuters analysis found, as 17 U.S. states reported weekly increases in the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Play video

341 days in isolation: How these newlyweds survived the remote northern wilderness

In 1979, Joanne and John Moore packed a year’s worth of food and equipment and set out for mountainous solitude in the Northwest Territories. They spent the summer building a log cabin and exploring the South Nahanni River valley, but the darkness of winter cast a shadow their newly minted relationship had to endure.

Play video

Opinion

Weighing the impact of COVID-19 on the real estate market

Economist Mohamed El-Erian says that the coronavirus shutdown will create a buyer's market for real estate, offset by reduced incomes putting stress on the whole sector. El-Erian was in conversation with Rudyard Griffiths from the Munk Debates.

Play video

Opinion

Malcolm Gladwell on the world after COVID-19

Author and journalist Malcolm Gladwell discusses the far-reaching impact of the coronavirus pandemic on refugees, conflict and the economy. Gladwell was in conversation with Rudyard Griffiths from the Munk Debates.

Play video

The pros and cons of three homemade masks

Now that it is recommended you wear a face covering in dense public settings like grocery stores and pharmacies, watch how to make the three masks recommended by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Written instructions available at tgam.ca/masks

Play video

Opinion

Historian Niall Ferguson compares COVID-19 to past pandemics

Historian Niall Ferguson compares COVID-19 to past global sicknesses, likening it to a flu pandemic that hit in the 1950s. He also says the coronavirus will accelerate the emergence of a new Cold War between China and the U.S. Mr. Ferguson was in conversation with Rudyard Griffiths from the Munk Debates.
